main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in the vicinity of Presque Isle, Maine, in October 1953, including bright luminous objects observed traveling at high speeds, emitting intermittent red and green lights, and displaying erratic flight paths. Radar reports indicated the presence of unidentified targets with no lights, tracked only on radar, and displaying speeds exceeding 170 knots.
interesting points: The objects were observed emitting intermittent red and green lights and appeared to be of circular-oval shape.
Observers estimated the altitude of the luminous objects to be around 20,000 feet with speeds greater than 600 miles per hour.
A military source reported observing four bright yellow-orange objects, about the size of a star, moving across the sky at high speed, reversing direction, and disappearing within 5 seconds.
The targets observed on radar did not display any lights and were tracked only on radar, with no existing physical evidence obtained.
The radar scope displayed a series of concentric circles and radial lines, indicating the presence of unidentified targets radiating in a 270-degree pattern.
sighted object: bright luminous objects and radar targets with no lights
photographs: no photographs included in the report
